intro: Alcea heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Alcea heldreichii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with full sun.
